# Mobile User Experience Options When Untrusted TLS Version is Detected

Last updated November 6, 2023 by Appdome

3 Easy Steps to Notify Users When Untrusted TLS Version Detected. Protect mobile app data-in-transit and ensure safe connections. No Code, No SDK, Continuous Security.

Learn how to customize the TLS Enforcement Notification that will display to a mobile user if Appdome detects the use of unauthorized or unapproved TLS Version in sessions established with your app.

## App Compromise Notifications – (TLS Version Enforcement)

Appdome enables you to enforce that TLS version 1.2 or higher are used for connections established with a mobile app. If Appdome detects the use of any TLS version earlier than TLS 1.2, the default behavior is to drop the connection and display an App Compromise Notification to the mobile user.

This Knowledge Base article provides instructions on how to customize the App Compromise notification message when Appdome detects the use of unauthorized or older TLS versions.

We hope you find it useful and enjoy using Appdome!

## 3 Easy Steps to Notify Users When Untrusted TLS Version Detected

Follow these 3 Easy Steps to customize the App Compromise Notification for TLS Version Enforcement.

You can customize the **App Compromise Notification** displayed to mobile users when security events trigger the app to exit.

Please follow these steps to [add a mobile app to your Appdome account](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project/).

1. From “Build”, click  **Security,** then  **Secure Communications**, and Turn on **Trusted Session**
2. Expand **Session Management,** Enable  “**Enforce TLS Version**”
   * (Optional) Enable [Threat Events](/how-to/application-threat-intelligence/mobile-threat-events/use-appdome-mobile-app-threat-intelligence/) and customize the text in the **App Compromise Notification** free-form text box.
3. Click **Build My App**

Appdome’s no-code mobile app security platform offers mobile developers, DevSec and security professionals a convenient and reliable way to protect Android and iOS apps. When an Appdome user clicks “Build My App,” Appdome leverages a microservice architecture filled with 1000s of security plugins, and an adaptive code generation engine that matches the correct required plugins to the development environment, frameworks, and methods in each app.

### Prerequisites

Here’s what you need to build secured apps with App Compromomise Notifications.

* Appdome account (If you don’t have an Appdome account, [create a free Appdome account here)](https://fusion.appdome.com/signup)
* [Mobile App](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/how-appdome-works/begin-no-code-mobile-app-security-project) (.ipa for iOS, or .apk or .aab for Android)
* [Signing Credentials](https://www.appdome.com/how-to/dev-sec-tools/signing-secured-apps/automated-code-signing-options-secured-android-ios-apps) (e.g., signing certificates and provisioning profile)

### No Coding Dependency

Using Appdome, there are no development or coding prerequisites to build secured apps with dynamic windows protection.  There is no SDK and no library to manually code or implement in the app. The Appdome technology adds the relevant standards, frameworks, and logic to the app automatically, with no manual development work at all.
